title: Why are horror movies so fun to watch? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because they involve an element of risk. Will I’ll be able to handle what I am seeing - or will it frighten me too much? It’s like standing close to the edge of a cliff, and looking over, to see how much it affects you. Also, when a horror movie has a good story, and we relate to the characters, then we care about what happens to them — even if it is the monster! The group experience of watching horror is also what makes it fun. Every enjoyable experience you’ve had with a horror film, is usually with a friend, or a group of friends, when you can laugh and joke and yell at the screen - and see who jumps the most at the crucial scenes; then talk about it afterwards. You mostly watch horror films as a teenager - and that’s the time in your life when you are actively chasing ‘thrills’. People that don’t find horror films fun, or exciting, will avoid them.

It’s like a roller coaster or other fair ride (only safer!) We like thrills and adventure. And unlike a ride at the fair, if it gets too intense we can walk out or turn off the DVD player. It’s a safe “ride” usually. It also allows us to let off steam and scream in a socially appropriate/approved way.
